Study title: A Pilot Study of Chimeric Antigen Receptor (CAR) T Cells Targeting B7-H3 Antigen in Treating Patients With Recurrent and Refractory Glioblastoma
An Open, Single-arm, Phase 1 Study to Evaluate the Safety/Preliminary Effectiveness and Determine the Maximal Tolerated Dose of B7-H3-targeting CAR-T Cell Therapy in Treating Recurrent Glioblastomas
B7-H3-Targeted Chimeric Antigen Receptor (CAR) T Cells in Treating Patients With Recurrent or Refractory Glioblastoma
Phase I Study of Intraventricular Infusion of T Cells Expressing B7-H3 Specific Chimeric Antigen Receptors (CAR) in Subjects With Recurrent or Refractory Glioblastoma
Phase I Clinical Trial of Locoregionally (LR) Delivered Autologous B7-H3 Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cells (B7-H3CART) in Adults With Recurrent Glioblastoma Multiforme (GBM)
